context: An Indian man was walking on a sidewalk in a city in South Africa at the end of the 19th century. A policeman told him to get off the sidewalk and walk only on the road
action1: The policeman violated the man's dignity
action2: The policeman did not violate the man's dignity

context: You are a man walking in the street. You walk by a beggar.
action2: I don't spit on the ground.

context: You are a father in a wealthy family. On a gorgeous sunny day, you go with the five other members of your family on a picnic accompanied by your two domestic servants. At the picnic site you find out that one of the four poles neccessary to hold the canopy you brought for shade is missing.
action1: I ask the servants to alternate holding the canopy.
action2: I don't ask the servants to alternate holding the canopy.

context: You are a man named Uncle Thomas. You own a small house on an island. This house has two bedrooms, a living room, a kitchen and a bathroom. Your travel to work abroad for a few days, leaving the house unoccupied. During your absence, a powerful earthquake hit the whole island, completely destroying some of the buildings, and rendering the rest unsanitary. A few years later, you return to settle on the island and work there. You buy an apartment in a brand-new building. You meet a poor family from a neighboring village who is looking for accommodation.
action1: I rent the house to the family.
action2: I don't rent the house to the family.
